section.title: pn_enable (boolean)
section.para: Enable SIP Push Notifications support (RFC 8599). If enabled, contacts URIs which include all will be matched against existing bindings using only these parameters. Otherwise, the module will attempt to match them as usual, using the current matching_mode.

section.title: pn_providers (string)
section.para: A list of supported Push Notification providers. While only three possible values are defined by RFC 8599 ("apns", "fcm" and "webpush"), non-standard values may be specified as well.

section.title: pn_ct_match_params (string)
section.para: The minimally required list of RFC 8599 parameters (custom ones are accepted as well) which must be present in a Contact URI and identically matching an existing binding in order for the binding to be refreshed. If at least one such parameter is missing from a Contact header field URI, the module will fall back to performing regular contact matching.

Note that if all above PN Contact URI parameters match an existing binding, the match is considered to be successful regardless if other parts of the SIP URI do not match (e.g. hostname, port, other URI parameters, etc.).

section.title: pn_pnsreg_interval (integer)
section.para: For devices capable of waking up and refreshing their binding on their own (signified by the ";+sip.pnsreg" Contact header field parameter), this parameter denotes the prior-to-expiration interval advertised by the server at which the device should issue its binding refresh request.
